50.0: Migdol of salvations for God's king. That is to say, that that [God] is a stronghold of salvations for God's king, and that [latter] is David, just as a migdal (מגדל, the normative word for 'tower') is a stronghold of a city.

0.0: ...The sin was in [the fact] that David, the anointed one of the God of Jacob and the sweet singer of Israel, placed his trust in the flesh of his forearm - upon his [having] many people. And it was not fitting that he should place his faith 'in many people [that] is the glory of the king,' but rather only in God. For there is nothing that prevents Him from saving through the many or the few...
